Class Toy

java.lang.Object
GraphicObject
Toy
All Implemented Interfaces:
Drawable, MouseListener, Movable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Car, Hoverball, TeddyBear
public class Toy extends GraphicObject implements MouseListener, Movable
This class models Toy objects in the p05 Toy Saga II program

    Field
    Description

    Constructs a new Toy object positioned at the center of the display window.
    Toy(String filename, int x, int y)
    Constructs a new Toy object positioned at the specific x and y position within the display window.

  • Field Details

    • isDragging

      private boolean isDragging
      indicates whether this Toy object is being dragged or not

  • Constructor Details

    • Toy

      public Toy(String filename)
      Constructs a new Toy object positioned at the center of the display window. The image assigned to this Toy object is defined by the provided filename. A newly created Toy object is not being dragged and have been rotated zero times.
      Parameters:
      filename - filename of the image of this Toy object.

    • Toy

      public Toy(String filename, int x, int y)
      Constructs a new Toy object positioned at the specific x and y position within the display window. The image assigned to this Toy object is defined by the provided filename. A newly created Toy object is not being dragged and have been rotated zero times.
      Parameters:
      filename - filename of the image of this Toy object.
      x - x-position (horizontal position) of this Toy object
      y - y-position (vertical position) of this Toy object

  • Method Details

    • draw

      public void draw()
      Draws this Toy to the display window at its current (x,y) position taking into account of its moves. This method first moves this toy by calling its move() method. Then, it draws it to the screen as a GraphicObject by calling the draw() method defined in the super class.
      Specified by:
      draw in interface Drawable
      Overrides:
      draw in class GraphicObject

    • isDragging

      public boolean isDragging()
      Checks whether this Toy object is dragging
      Returns:
      true if this toy objec is dragging

    • startDragging

      public void startDragging()
      Starts dragging this object by setting its instance field isDragging to true.

    • stopDragging

      public void stopDragging()
      Stops dragging this object by setting its instance field isDragging to false.

    • move

      public void move(int dx, int dy)
      Moves this toy object with the specific dx, and dy moves. This toy should not get out of the boundaries of the display window of the toy saga.
      Parameters:
      dx - horizontal move
      dy - vertical move

    • move

      public void move()
      If this toy is dragging, this method moves it following the mouse moves. The current x-position of the mouse is given by toySaga.mouseX The current y-position of the mouse is given by toySaga.mouseY The old x-position of the mouse (in the frame previous to the current frame) is given by toySaga.pmouseX The old y-position of the mouse (in the frame previous to the current frame) is given by toySaga.pmouseY
      Specified by:
      move in interface Movable

    • isOver

      public boolean isOver(int x, int y)
      Checks whether this Toy object is over a given point: (x, y) position in the screen.
      Parameters:
      x - x-position within the display window
      y - y-position within the display window
      Returns:
      true if this toy is over the specific (x,y) coordinates.

    • onClick

      public void onClick()
      If no toy is dragging within the toy saga, this method begins dragging this Toy if the mouse is over it and no toy is dragging in the toy saga scene
      Specified by:
      onClick in interface MouseListener

    • onRelease

      public void onRelease()
      Stops dragging this Toy
      Specified by:
      onRelease in interface MouseListener

    • isMouseOver

      public boolean isMouseOver()
      Returns true the mouse is over the this Toy
      Specified by:
      isMouseOver in interface MouseListener
      Returns:
      true if the mouse is over this toy.
